New Records: Francisco Lindor joined Shane Victorino and Hall of Fame slugger Jim Thome as the only major leaguers with two postseason grand slams.
Edgardo Alfonzo hit the only other postseason slam in Mets history, during a 1999 Division Series at Arizona.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, giving New York a 4-1 lead and sending the sold-out crowd of 44,103 into a delirious, bouncing, throbbing frenzy.
Jose Quintana didn't allow an earned run in five-plus innings of two-hit ball.
David Peterson pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Edwin DÃ­az struck out Kyle Schwarber with two runners aboard to end it as New York finished off the rival Phillies in Game 4 of their best-of-five Division Series, winning 3-1.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo said in a clubhouse interview shown on the giant videoboard in center. 'This is the kind of stuff that I was dreaming about. This has been a long time coming. We wanted it so bad for our fan base.'

Pete Alonso told reveling fans still in the stands when he popped out of the clubhouse party for an on-field interview with large goggles protecting his eyes. 'Let's keep this thing rolling! So proud of this group. We've overcome so much.'
Steve Cohen said. 'I want to slay the negative Met fan perceptions, and we're on our way to doing that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Citi Field, which has a 16-season history.
The Mets are chasing their third World Series title and first since 1986.
The Phillies are still looking for the franchise's third championship.
The Phillies were shut down at the plate all series besides a late comeback to win Game 2 at home.
Others: The New York Mets reached the National League Championship Series with a 4-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Wednesday.
The Phillies were eliminated from the playoffs with a 3-1 loss to the Mets in Game 4 of their best-of-five Division Series.
